"When rivers flow into the sea, let me embrace the desert."
The Tarim River, Chinaâ€™s longest inland river, starts at the foot of the second-highest peak in the world and flows through the largest desert. With just 1/200th of the Yangtzeâ€™s flow, itâ€™s a river that was once dead, now revived.
How did it transform the Sea of Death? Watch to find out.
